publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2027# Mrs Margaret Ewing: Excess Winter Deaths—That the Parliament notes with growing concern that, despite various efforts to reduce fuel poverty, excess winter deaths still continue to rise; believes that additional measures must be implemented to reverse this trend and eradicate this blight in an energy-rich nation, and therefore believes that the Scottish Executive should review the effectiveness of existing schemes. Supported by: Christine Grahame*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2027# Excess Winter Deaths (lodged on 17 November 2004) Stewart Stevenson*

S2M-2027# Mrs Margaret Ewing: Excess Winter Deaths—That the Parliament notes with growing concern that, despite various efforts to reduce fuel poverty, excess winter deaths still continue to rise; believes that additional measures must be implemented to reverse this trend and eradicate this blight in an energy-rich nation, and therefore believes that the Scottish Executive should review the effectiveness of existing schemes. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Stewart Stevenson, Fergus Ewing*
S2M-2027# Excess Winter Deaths (lodged on 17 November 2004) Brian Adam*, Mr Andrew Welsh*
S2M-2027# Excess Winter Deaths (lodged on 17 November 2004) Michael Matheson*
S2M-2027# Excess Winter Deaths (lodged on 17 November 2004) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-2027# Excess Winter Deaths (lodged on 17 November 2004) Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Rob Gibson*, Bruce Crawford*
S2M-2027# Excess Winter Deaths (lodged on 17 November 2004) Richard Lochhead*, Jim Mather*, Alex Neil*
S2M-2027# Excess Winter Deaths (lodged on 17 November 2004) Mr Bruce McFee*
S2M-2027# Excess Winter Deaths (lodged on 17 November 2004) John Swinburne*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-2027# Mrs Margaret Ewing: Excess Winter Deaths—That the Parliament notes with growing concern that, despite various efforts to reduce fuel poverty, excess winter deaths still continue to rise; believes that additional measures must be implemented to reverse this trend and eradicate this blight in an energy-rich nation, and therefore believes that the Scottish Executive should review the effectiveness of existing schemes. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Stewart Stevenson, Fergus Ewing, Brian Adam, Mr Andrew Welsh, Michael Matheson, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Rob Gibson, Bruce Crawford, Richard Lochhead, Jim Mather, Alex Neil, Mr Bruce McFee, John Swinburne, Ms Sandra White, Patrick Harvie*, Chris Ballance*, Colin Fox*, Eleanor Scott*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-2027# Excess Winter Deaths (lodged on 17 November 2004) Mr John Swinney*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Robin Harper*, Frances Curran*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-2027# Excess Winter Deaths (lodged on 17 November 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*, Rosie Kane*
